# Pituitary Gland
- lies in a small pocket of bone at the skull base called the sella turcica.
- The pituitary gland is connected to the [hypothalamus](Hypothalamus.qmd) of the brain by the pituitary stalk.
- Known as the “master gland,” it controls other endocrine glands in the body.
- It secretes hormones that control sexual development, promote bone and muscle growth, and respond to stress.

# Pituitary Gland
- An endocrine organ at the base of the brain that is closely linked with the [hypothalamus](hypothalamus.qmd). The pituitary gland is composed of two lobes, the anterior and posterior lobes, and secretes hormones that regulate the activity of the other endocrine organs in the body.
